sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_62500_mealplan_recipe"> <x_62500_mealplan_recipe action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <cook_time/> <cooking_instructions>1. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, minced ginger, and chopped green chili. Cook until onions are translucent. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 4. Stir in cashew nuts, garam masala, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and coriander powder. Cook for 2-3 minutes. 5. Allow the mixture to cool, then blend into a smooth paste. 6. Return the mixture to the pan and add chicken thighs. Cook until browned. 7. Add coconut milk and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until chicken is cooked through and sauce is thickened. 8. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or naan.</cooking_instructions> <cuisine display_value="Indian">8f495a179791021069a3b6fce053afcf</cuisine> <diet/> <effort/> <image/> <ingredients>Chicken Thighs (500g, boneless and skinl</ingredients> <meal_type display_value="Dinner">ca8516df9751021069a3b6fce053afdf</meal_type> <name>Chicken Korma</name> <nutrition>Calories: 400, Protein: 25g, Fat: 30g, Carbs: 15g</nutrition> <owned_by/> <pre_cook>false</pre_cook> <prep_instructions>1. Chop onion, tomato, garlic, ginger, and green chili. 2. Soak cashew nuts.</prep_instructions> <prep_required>false</prep_required> <prep_time/> <serving>2</serving> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2024-04-07 01:22:04</sys_created_on> <sys_id>7091d71f9795021069a3b6fce053afde</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2024-04-07 01:22:04</sys_updated_on> <time_of_day/> </x_62500_mealplan_recipe> </record_update>
